class.name: Phaser.Circle

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate of the center of the circle.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of the center of the circle.

parameters.name: diameter
parameters.help: The diameter of the circle.

class.help: Creates a new Circle object with the center coordinate specified by the x and y parameters and the diameter specified by the diameter parameter.\nIf you call this function without parameters, a circle with x, y, diameter and radius properties set to 0 is created.

public.name: circumference
public.help: The circumference of the circle.

public.name: circumferencePoint

returns.help: The Point object holding the result.

public.help: Returns a Point object containing the coordinates of a point on the circumference of the Circle based on the given angle.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first Circle object.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.help: The angle in radians (unless asDegrees is true) to return the point from.

parameters.name: asDegrees
parameters.help: Is the given angle in radians (false) or degrees (true)?

parameters.name: out
parameters.help: An optional Point object to put the result in to. If none specified a new Point object will be created.

public.name: clone
public.help: Returns a new Circle object with the same values for the x, y, width, and height properties as this Circle object.

parameters.name: output
parameters.help: Optional Circle object. If given the values will be set into the object, otherwise a brand new Circle object will be created and returned.

public.name: contains

returns.help: True if the coordinates are within this circle, otherwise false.

public.help: Return true if the given x/y coordinates are within the Circle object.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The Circle to be checked.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The X value of the coordinate to test.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The Y value of the coordinate to test.

public.name: copyFrom
public.help: Copies the x, y and diameter properties from any given object to this Circle.

parameters.name: source
parameters.help: The object to copy from.

public.name: copyTo
public.help: Copies the x, y and diameter properties from this Circle to any given object.

parameters.name: dest
parameters.help: The object to copy to.

public.name: distance

returns.help: The distance between this Point object and the destination Point object.

public.help: Returns the distance from the center of the Circle object to the given object\n(can be Circle, Point or anything with x/y properties)

parameters.name: dest
parameters.help: The target object. Must have visible x and y properties that represent the center of the object.

parameters.name: round
parameters.help: Round the distance to the nearest integer (default false).

public.name: equals

returns.help: A value of true if the object has exactly the same values for the x, y and diameter properties as this Circle object; otherwise false.

public.help: Determines whether the two Circle objects match. This method compares the x, y and diameter properties.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first Circle object.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second Circle object.

public.name: getBounds
public.help: Returns the framing rectangle of the circle as a Phaser.Rectangle object

public.name: intersects

returns.help: A value of true if the specified object intersects with this Circle object; otherwise false.

public.help: Determines whether the two Circle objects intersect.\nThis method checks the radius distances between the two Circle objects to see if they intersect.

parameters.name: a
parameters.help: The first Circle object.

parameters.name: b
parameters.help: The second Circle object.

public.name: intersectsRectangle

returns.help: True if the two objects intersect, otherwise false.

public.help: Checks if the given Circle and Rectangle objects intersect.

parameters.name: c
parameters.help: The Circle object to test.

parameters.name: r
parameters.help: The Rectangle object to test.

public.name: offset
public.help: Adjusts the location of the Circle object, as determined by its center coordinate, by the specified amounts.

parameters.name: dx
parameters.help: Moves the x value of the Circle object by this amount.

parameters.name: dy
parameters.help: Moves the y value of the Circle object by this amount.

public.name: offsetPoint
public.help: Adjusts the location of the Circle object using a Point object as a parameter. This method is similar to the Circle.offset() method, except that it takes a Point object as a parameter.

parameters.name: point
parameters.help: A Point object to use to offset this Circle object (or any valid object with exposed x and y properties).

public.name: setTo
public.help: Sets the members of Circle to the specified values.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: The x coordinate of the center of the circle.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: The y coordinate of the center of the circle.

parameters.name: diameter
parameters.help: The diameter of the circle.

public.name: toString

returns.help: a string representation of the instance.

public.help: Returns a string representation of this object.

public.name: area
public.help: The area of this Circle.

public.name: bottom
public.help: The sum of the y and radius properties. Changing the bottom property of a Circle object has no effect on the x and y properties, but does change the diameter.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the bottom of the circle.

public.name: diameter
public.help: The largest distance between any two points on the circle. The same as the radius * 2.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the diameter of the circle.

public.name: empty
public.help: Determines whether or not this Circle object is empty. Will return a value of true if the Circle objects diameter is less than or equal to 0; otherwise false.\nIf set to true it will reset all of the Circle objects properties to 0. A Circle object is empty if its diameter is less than or equal to 0.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the empty state of the circle.

public.name: radius
public.help: The length of a line extending from the center of the circle to any point on the circle itself. The same as half the diameter.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the radius of the circle.

public.name: right
public.help: The x coordinate of the rightmost point of the circle. Changing the right property of a Circle object has no effect on the x and y properties. However it does affect the diameter, whereas changing the x value does not affect the diameter property.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the value of the rightmost point of the circle.

public.name: top
public.help: The sum of the y minus the radius property. Changing the top property of a Circle object has no effect on the x and y properties, but does change the diameter.
public.inlineHelp: Gets or sets the top of the circle.

public.name: x
public.inlineHelp: The x coordinate of the center of the circle.

public.name: y
public.inlineHelp: The y coordinate of the center of the circle.
